references.paper_title: Flamingo: a visual language model for few-shot learning
references.reason: This paper introduces Flamingo, a visual language model that inspires the core concept of Moto's bridging language for robot manipulation.
This foundational paper demonstrates the success of autoregressive pre-training in large language models, providing a theoretical basis for Moto's pre-training approach.

references.paper_title: OpenFlamingo: An open-source framework for training large autoregressive vision-language models
references.reason: This paper introduces OpenFlamingo, an open-source framework that serves as a practical foundation for building and evaluating large vision-language models, which greatly influences Moto's implementation.

references.paper_title: RT-1: Robotics transformer for real-world control at scale
references.reason: This paper presents RT-1, a robotics transformer for real-world control, providing a baseline for comparison and demonstrating the state-of-the-art in robot manipulation.

references.paper_title: CALVIN: A benchmark for language-conditioned policy learning for long-horizon robot manipulation tasks
references.reason: This paper introduces CALVIN, a benchmark dataset used for evaluating Moto's performance on long-horizon robot manipulation tasks, and provides a standard for comparison with other methods.
